A LOT TO ANSWER FOR.Definition: to be responsible for a lot of bad things

A STRETCH.Definition: something that is hard to believe

ABDUCTING.Definition: making someone come with you, especially by using force

ABDUCTIONS.Definition: making someone come with you, especially by using force

BINOCULARS.Definition: a handheld tool to help you see things in the distance

CAPSIZE.Definition: (of a boat) to turn upside down

CITED.Definition: mentioned as a way of explaining something

COMPENSATION.Definition: money that is paid in exchange for something, often lost or stolen

FAINTER.Definition: less strong and able to be heard or seen

FAR-FETCHED.Definition: unlikely to be true and (therefore) hard to believe

MAHOGANY.Definition: a dark, expensive wood often used to make furniture

NANNIES.Definition: people whose job it is to look after the children of a family

SENSATIONALIST.Definition: reporting events to make them sound as strange as possible, even if they are not

SQUID.Definition: a sea creature with a long body and tentacles

THOUGHT MUCH OF IT.Definition: think it is important or worth discussion
